ClientInterfaces

Class KMIPOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientInterfaces.KMIPOperations
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreateKey, CreateKeyPair, DestroyKey, GetKey, LocateKey, SetAttribute

    public class KMIPOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    This class establishes connection with the key management server, sends request message, receives response message and sends it to DOM Parser for extracing important information from it.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vedika Ghei, Soha Parasnis, Tanisha Rathi, Vidushi Mishra
    See Also:
    Connection, KeyUniqueIDMap, CreateRequestMessage, DecodeResponseMessage

      static byte[] getXMLOutMessage(byte[] dataOut, Connection connection)
      This method forms the complete request message (HTTP Header + the actual XML Request Message)
      void HTTPSMethod(java.io.File f, KeyUniqueIDMap k, Connection connection)
      This method sends the request (received in a file) to the server, received response message from the server, separates the response message from the response's HTTP header, writes the response message to a file.

        public static byte[] getXMLOutMessage(byte[] dataOut,
                                      Connection connection)
        This method forms the complete request message (HTTP Header + the actual XML Request Message)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        byte[] the combined request message is returned.

      • createXMLHeader

                                               Connection connection)
        This method creates the HTTP header.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • HTTPSMethod

        public void HTTPSMethod(java.io.File f,
                        KeyUniqueIDMap k,
                        Connection connection)
        This method sends the request (received in a file) to the server, received response message from the server, separates the response message from the response's HTTP header, writes the response message to a file.
        Parameters:
        f - File which has the request message combined with the HTTP header.
        k - KeyUniqueIDMap object.
        connection - Connection object which contains the socket and the IP and port number of the server.
